org.jgentleframework.core.reflection.metadata
Interface AnnoMeta

All Superinterfaces:
Metadata
public interface AnnoMeta
extends Metadata

Represents the annotation metadata will be created in JGentle system. An annotation metadata will hold a list of metadatas which may be another annotation metadatas or basic datas (values of attributes of an annotation) are interpreted.

If annotation metadata is interpreted of annotation, key of it will be the instance which is annotated with that annotation, and value will be the annotation instance.

Author:
LE QUOC CHUNG - mailto: skydunkpro@yahoo.com
See Also:

 int count()
          Returns the number of all metadatas in current annotation metadata
 Metadata getMetadata(java.lang.Object key)
          Returns the metadata corresponds to the given object key, or null if current annotation metadata doesn't contain any mapping corresponding to the given key.
 java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,Metadata> getMetaList()
          Returns the map containing all metadatas in current annotation metadata
 java.lang.String getName()
          Returns the name of this annotation metadata, if it's not specified, a default name is name of object class of annotation metadata will be returned.
 AnnoMeta getParents()
          Returns the parents of current annotation metadata, if returning value is null, it will be key of one definition.
 java.lang.Class<?> getType()
          Returns the object class type of current annotation metadata
 boolean isEmpty()
          Returns true if current annotation metadata is empty, otherwise returns false.
 java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> keySet()
          Returns a set of keys corresponds to all metadatas existing in current annotation metadata
